title: Large-Scale Simulation-Based Instructional Design Course for Realistic Mathematics Education

context.prior_knowledge: Understanding of Elementary Mathematics Fundamentals and Practical Experience in Educational Settings
context.additional_context: Course where elementary school teachers experience Realistic Mathematics Education (RME) principles through VR simulations and learn to design student-led modeling and argumentation processes

learning_goals: Learners can apply RME’s core principles (contextual problem presentation, student-led modeling, social interaction) to actual lesson design.
In VR simulation environments, learners can analyze students’ argumentation processes and develop at least three instructional strategies that promote mathematical model formation.
Through project-based assessments, learners can submit lesson designs that demonstrate the applicability of RME principles.

resources: RME (Realistic Mathematics Education) theory reference guide

difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
